text: Also you can right click and clone modules.

*Found a bug* <https://spin.d.pr/y1tUOn+>
The new icon field throws an error when you use the code provided in the copy snippet feature.
This has been on their radar for awhile but have yet to release a fix.
ahh
any idea how to  use the field despite this annoyingness?

nevermind I think I’ve come to the conclusion the Icon field doesn’t work at all yet.

I’d honestly recommend hiding this field until it’s ready for prime time..
I've definitely gotten it working before
I don't really know what the difference between my code and yours is, though
"links" is a repeater group
Is yours a repeater of just the icon field? If that's the case I think `item.icon` should just be `item`
This was a known issue, but I believe it was fixed. I’ll check in with the team
Have you chosen a default icon?
I think that is likely the problem I didn’t have one set
still it shouldn’t really require one or should state in the error that it does need one to work or something
Agree!
Didn’t mean for that to be the solution, just a way to get your module working for now
well appreciate it. will probably revert back to using the icon field again then knowing that might to the trick will let you know if it still doesn’t work.
:thumbsup: let me know. I raised the issue with the team again so we can hopefully get it working 100%

setting a default via the fields options does not appear to fix the issues getting 3 errors
<https://spin.d.pr/iKUCDt+>
can you try to publish or refresh your browser?
refreshed, one error went away.(the exception one)
hmm
I don’t think the token errors are related to the icon
but I could be wrong
they go away when I remove the hubl for the icon
it looks like it doesn’t like the brackets being used in the values in this case
Gotcha. I’d steer clear of using this in repeaters for the time being. Will report back as soon as its fixed
here’s the problem: <https://spin.d.pr/brnb1u+>
sorry about that
it’s alright. hope it gets fixed soon, looks like an awesome tool to have
hmm actually, I’m not getting these errors at all if there is a default icon chosen
any chance you can dm me a link to this module?
maybe I need to use the |default filter
thanks, taking a look
haha pretty awesome, I’m seeing your changes live in the preview window
haha, yeah that’s a….feature
so, i changed the repeating group to have a minimum of 1 and it cleared up the error, but nothing seems to render in the preview
interesting
maybe in the mean time I guess till it works, throw up a message somewhere when someone tries to add an icon field to group or in console loop “sorry Icons are not loopable yet stay tuned!”
Hopefully this can just get fixed in short order… but that’s a good call.
So, as long as you eliminate instances where there would be no default, it should be safe to use. So that means: give it a default, make it required, make sure that your repeating group has min >= 1
not a big deal at all - but it’d be nice if when you view dependents of a file - it expanded the dropdowns by default if there were less than say 5 items in a dropdown

This is kind of an idea but it also involves just the DMv2, is there a way we can get a "Post" Field type that would be similar to the "Page" field type which you can select a certain blog post? This would help in building out a more customized "related posts" module. I know there is a related posts module now in beta, but having a posts field type would allow you to have a completely manual version where editors could choose what articles they wanted to show in section (without having to use the `blog_post_by_id` function and making them enter it that way)
I think something more valuable would be by campaign
If you have 8 blog posts related to a campaign, that might be a little better
What would that look like? A fuzzy match / title match drop down similar to the hubdb table / page selectors?
<@U4RP6AGV9> something like this
naturally there would be a previous dropdown to select a certain blog then go through those posts
I don’t see any reason why this would be a problem for them to implement. I think it will follow VERY quickly after the recommended blog posts module

honestly I feel there should be a master URL field with toggle able options.

So we’d be able to toggle if the user could pick a blog post, a page, a landing page, or type a custom url
I’ve essentially built this multiple times into custom modules using conditionals and it’s a lot of work but the marketers like the easy of use..
I know its a hot topic in the forums too about related posts but more of the "we want to manually populate the related posts"

I am imagining an (ideal) situation where the related posts widget is SO customizable (i.e. you can tweak the algorithm so much and with such precision) that you can essentially get the exact posts you want
But the need for a manual selection option seems too obvious
can’t you just in the template  have a boolean and swap what you show - the related posts or your custom related posts?
I know in the current related posts module there is a `blog_post_ids` but i think thats more for choosing which blogs you want to gra related posts from more accurately
oh yea you totally could do that <@U7SL518D6> I was just thinking the easier way for users to select the blog would be through a selector like the page one

so I haven’t used the related posts module yet but I talked with the devs when they were building it I had suggested the blog_post_ids bit so essentially what you’d do is when you’re wanting specific posts you list the ids of the ones you’re wanting to find the most related among
so for example instead of searching the entire blog you could check against a few posts
and well if you only specified say 1 post
then it would always be the most related
giving you the exact posts you wanted
im going to have to try it out with that value populated and see what it returns exactly

I’ve never played with that tag or the function(I had suggested it was more useful as a function, not sure if they’ve built that) so in practice It could function different - I just know conceptually what we had talked about.
I’ll see if I can dig up what was discussed regarding it
as it might provide more info than docs
I feel like this should have its own channel like the search does
then we can make recommendations on making this better
Ill create it now
I’ll invite the devs that talked to me about it
i invited Steven McKinless and Victoria as those are the ones i talked too about it

is there any way to get all the advanced menu links for a particular menu  in a module variable so that we can put in our own markup? Working on putting our own web site on HubSpot COS (<http://unific.com|unific.com>) and would love to have full control. Read some articles that it’s not possible without manually adding the menu links, but just throught I’d ask in case there have been updates.
As far as I know that hasn't changed

<@UBRG1R3EW> It's not possible for advanced menus but I think you can pull in the items from a simple menu in a variable. I know I've seen some people either create a menu as a custom module or even do it via hubdb for full customization (granted doing it those ways would mean you cant use the menu manager in settings)
best way to add your own markup is to make use of Javascript and add/unwrap items as needed to customize the markup
if your looking to create your menu as is now on your site, you should be able to simply add a class to the menu and then use CSS to change the styling as needed

I second the build your own menus with hubdb. We did that for a client and it worked out pretty well. You can then customize it a lot more (classes per item, levels, show/hide on mobile selection, icons per item, etc). We got away with writing less css this way
Built a mega menu of sorts like this
